CatDescriptText: Mrs. Jane Wynn, housewife, 804 River Avenue, Coraopolis, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 6, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that too much leniency is shown teenagers who commit crimes?" answer reads: "I believe that there is too much leniency shown towards some teenage criminals. From 13 years of age and up, a child knows what he is doing.  In my opinion, there should be a place to put teenagers, who commit crimes, like murder or attempted murder, and these institutions should not be like Morganza or Thorn Hill, but more strongly disciplined and of such a type that the young criminals cannot get out in two or three years."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Jane Wynn wearing dark flecked coat, patterned neck scarf, standing in front of stone block wall, store window on left displaying large candy cane
